page.title: 15Industry in Hungerford.
page.content: Over 300 people have lost their jobs in Hungerford over the last 3 years as several businesses have gone bankrupt or consolidated elsewhere. Two examples are Davidsons, plastic bottle suppliers and Rank Hovis Mc Dougall who produced animal feeds. There are now several vacant sites around the town and a group of local people are trying to attract new small industry by advertising using a video film of the town.However there are some light industries still operating successfully including Digital,Saxon Industries Loheat, Hungerford Framers, Oakes Brothers.A new small industry is Albear Ltd. which opened in 1981. They employ 12 people and make and design exhibition stands.These are used at Olympia and Earl's Court and go to several European countries.
